name: Portfolio Website
description: This is the static portfolio project you're currently navigating. This portfolio showcases my Front-end skills, projects, and work experience I have done over the past 5 years at UVic and on Co-ops. I developed this portfolio website using Chakra UI, a React component library, and TypeScript. Currently, hosted using AWS Amplify on a Route 53 custom domain.

name: Pomodoro timer and to do list
description: This is a static React.js web application I developed to manage my time better using Pomodoro principles. The general idea behind this application is to make a to-do list and complete tasks during the work timer phases and take breaks during the break phases to avoid burnout.

name: Horoscope Generator
description: A simple 10-hour project I developed. This application produces the same horoscope for all 12 zodiac signs as a joke. Ultimately, I developed this application to improve my React.tsx skills and develop a mobile-friendly application.

name: Embedded ARM Machine RGB to YCC Conversion
description: This was an embedded final group project for the Embedded Systems course I took in my last semester at UVic. Our group developed an embedded C program to perform color conversion, optimizing it with embedded techniques. I also designed hardware assist circuitry for the ARM system.

name: Redis Bookstore Cache
description: This application allows users to order books from a mock bookstore. Orders are stored in a Dockerized Redis Cache database. The project helped me familiarize myself with NoSQL databases and dockerizing app components.

name: Scalability Day Trading Project
description: Our group project for the Software System Scalability course at UVic involved creating a scalable mock day trading app. We used AWS and Docker to scale the system, and I became more familiar with AWS and scaling software.

name: Linear Programming Solver
description: A final project for the Linear Programming course at UVic, where I developed a Python-based linear programming solver that determines optimal solutions to linear equations.

name: Top Down Royal (TDR)
description: A multiplayer online battle royale game I developed for the Software Architecture and Design course at UVic. The game uses TCP and UDP connections, and I helped design the game mechanics and system architecture.

name: ACID Compliant SQL Airport Database
description: A final project for the Database Systems course at UVic, where I developed a PostgreSQL-based airport scheduling database, maintaining ACID principles using transactions and rollbacks.
